alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Orleans; Washington; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lamoille, western Caledonia, southwestern Orleans, northeastern Chittenden and northeastern Washington Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Westford, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Morrisville, Johnson Village, Underhill, Cambridge, Morrisville Village, Westford, Hyde Park, Wolcott, Underhill State Park, Morristown, Hyde Park Village, Johnson, Cambridge Village, Jeffersonville Village, Elmore, Essex, Craftsbury, Hardwick, Stowe and Jericho. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central, northeastern and northwestern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Orleans; Washington; Western Chittenden
